strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Ensure the cutting area is well-lit to reduce visual noise and improve clarity.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Install overhead lighting or use a task lamp for better visibility on the cutting board.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Use tools like non-slip mats or clamps to minimize object movement caused by sensory uncertainty.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Place a non-slip mat under the cutting board to prevent shifting.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Draw or mark cutting lines to provide clear visual cues for precise cuts.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Mark portions on a cake before slicing to guide the knife.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Use tools with ergonomic or textured grips to reduce tactile uncertainty.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Choose a knife with a non-slip handle for better control.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Use tools with built-in mechanisms to regulate force and improve precision.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Employ a mandoline slicer with adjustable thickness settings.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Start with light pressure and adjust based on resistance feedback.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Apply gradual force while cutting hard vegetables like carrots.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Double-check that the object is securely positioned before starting the cut.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Hold the object firmly or use a fork to stabilize it.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Stop the cutting task briefly to reduce uncertainty and verify progress.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Check the cut depth and adjust alignment before continuing.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Reduce environmental distractions like noise or clutter that can add to sensory uncertainty.
strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.example: Keep the workspace organized and free from unnecessary items.

strategies_for_sensory_noise_or_uncertai.description: Combine visual, tactile, and auditory feedback to confirm cutting progress.
